name: ALERT
description: The ALERT table contains one record for every alert that was created in Hyperspace. Each record is based on the alert ID and contains key information about the alert such as the patient, patient CSN, alert type, and whether it was seen by a user.

columns.name: ALT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the alert.

columns.name: ALERT_DESC
columns.description: A brief description of the alert.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique patient ID of the patient for whom the alert fired.  You could link it to PATIENT.PAT_ID to get patient specific information.

columns.name: PAT_CSN
columns.description: The contact serial number for the patient encounter in which the alert was fired. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in your system.  If alerts are triggered in a patient-specific encounter, they are saved in a corresponding encounter. This can be used to join to PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID to get the encounter information.

columns.name: PUMP_ID
columns.description: The unique external device ID of the pump selected in response to the warning after trying to program the pump.

columns.name: MAR_ACTION_C_NAME
columns.description: The MAR action category ID selected in response to the warning after trying to program the pump.

columns.name: MED_ALERT_SUBTYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: Subtype of medication alert type.  This is currently used only for alerts of type 23 - Error while checking interactions
entries: Too Many Signed and Held Orders - Checking Limited
Too Many Signed and Held Orders - Checking Suspended

columns.name: NBA_LOCATOR_ID
columns.description: The ID of the action record correlated with this next best action event.

columns.name: NBA_GUARANTOR_ACCT_ID
columns.description: The guarantor account correlated with this next best action event.

columns.name: NBA_PROSPECT_RECORD_ID
columns.description: The prospective patient correlated with this next best action event.

columns.name: BLOOD_ALERT_BUCKET_C_NAME
columns.description: The blood alert bucket category ID for the alert.
entries: No Blood Bank for this Patient
Blood Bank Info for this Patient

columns.name: RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: This column contains a record status flag of soft deleted, hidden, or hidden and soft deleted. Use it in conjunction with the record archived flag (REC_ARCHIVED_YN) for encounter archiving.
